item.description:
Hi Everyone,
Its not really us kayaking, its most likely raining Thursday ??? dont know, too soon for any weather prediction to be accurate enough.

Here is something to do on a Thursday night and promote a healthier diet and see a presentation..
Sounds good to me.. Im going, may meet new members if not its ok too..etc...

Oh i know the info says to bring enough for 6- 8 ..but we all know from our own pot lucks there will be way too much food waste.
I say bring enough what you eat and some more ? (you choose) , it has always worked out on every single one of our events in general.
This being somewhat more of a healthier thinking bunch, i would say bring fruits of some kind..ya dont have to prepare em, ya just eat what is there.. ya take home whats not eaten for the next day..etc....and its healthy all around.. again you choose..
Im getting something from ALDI's what ever looks good , dont know yet..
Mmmm Almond Stollen... maybe Banannas, blue berries..
Plastic cheez wiz ?? isnt this that silly string stuff ??
Na will bring something good...LOL



Here is the info i got from Dianne

What Dianne wrote:
----------------------------------------------------------------
Hello there!
You and your members might like to come to this wonderful event


Thursday June 10th- Sierra Club Hartford chapter
Potluck supper and slide show. Westmoor Park, Flagg Road , West
Hartford
The potluck (we eat outside if it isn't raining) is surrounded
by the gorgeous perennial gardens in full bloom. It is a
beautiful spot.
We will have a leisurely dinner and then have a great
presentation on your next vacation destination- Greenland!? I
saw in a magazine that they are farming a lot of cabbage there!
There will also be doorprizes.
Please bring some food (try to keep it "green"- low on the food
chain) to share with other outdoor-loving friends.
Doors open at 6:00. Dinner from 6:30-7:30, meeting and program
starts at 7:30.
Bring a dish (entree, salad, dessert) to serve 6-8. Plus own
place setting(s) and mug if you can---- Beverages provided.
Our presentation is on sea kayaking in western Greenland, where
3000-foot-tall mountains plunge straight down into icy waters
and huge icebergs can ground out in 700 feet of water. Bruce
Hooke, professional photographer and kayak trip leader from RI,
will be showing photographs from two kayaking trips he made in
these waters.
Free and open to all.

Info: 860-573-3501


Getting There:
Use your GPS or map program since there is so many ways here.



We are located on Flagg Road in West Hartford, hidden between the bustle of Bishops Corner shops, Mountain Road, and Route 44.

119 Flagg Road

West Hartford, CT 06119

(860)561-8260
item.how_to_find_us: I will be wearing a ORANGE Something, not sure yet..cant wear a hunting vest or hat..maybe my PFD ??

group.who: River and Shore Kayak-r's of CT
group.name: ~~~~HARTFORD COUNTY RIVERS & CT SHORE KAYAK GROUP~~~~ HCR-SK

item.name: Greenland Kayaking Presentation and Pot Luck Dinner by The Sierra Club
